text: footage from surveillance cameras shows
the moment the quake struck at 4:30 on a
Sunday afternoon when many people would
have been at home those that could
rushed to the safety of the outdoors
later pictures from chinese state media
showed a major rescue operation getting
underway yunnan province is in one of
china's most earthquake-prone regions
and the army and the civil authorities
are well prepared for this kind of
disaster some rescue workers will have
had experience in previous earthquakes
although the challenges can be numerous
the epicenter of this quake was in you
Nan's ludian county remote and
mountainous but nonetheless home to more
than a quarter of a million people
communications are reported to be
seriously affected and some roads have
been blocked by landslides it may be
some time possibly days before the
authorities are able to properly assess
the scale of the death and destruction
meanwhile as well as the rescue work a
large-scale relief operation has begun
with thousands of tents and beds being
sent to the affected areas john sud
worth BBC News Shanghai
